title: Help installing/using Robofab
content:
Hi there.

I took a look at the install chapter on robofab's web page but didn't helped me that much. I've never used this kind of aplications and I don't have much experience using macros or scripts, so any easy aproach on how to install/use them would be greatlly apreciated.

I'm running FL5 with Python v.2.4.4, on Windows Vista,

Thanks in advance  
Regards
author: kiko

Hi, and thanks for reply

After opening the zip folder containing robofab 86, I have just tried to run the install.py file, and moved the folders to the macro folder in fontlab installation location.  
I've also installed Numpy 1.1.0 for python 2.4 and TTX font tools.

This error message apears in the output window in FL.

Thanks

Make sure you'll do the following:  
- Download the latest version from robofab.org (Robofab + FontTools + DialogKit)  
- After unzipping, place the RoboFab folder somewhere on your harddrive. I've put mine in my applications folder  
- Run install\_zip.py  
- Copy \*only\* the folder named 'Scripts' to your FontLab macro folder

If you move the folder with the Robofab data to another location you need to run the install script again.

Hope this helps.

-Paul

Now is asking for Numpy

Oka. Finally I get it running on PC.

Posting this just in case someone else find it useful:  
- I ended up with 2 version of Python installed: 2.4 and 2.6  
- FontLab, for some reason, is using Python2.4  
- The latest version of Numpy1.5.1 uses Pyhton2.6, FontLab ignores it.  
- To install Numpy for Python2.4, I used and old Numpy1.2.1 release.
